allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add brain layer \(6 modules, 18 tools\) + context engineering features

Brain layer implements hybrid B+C architecture with agent-ready seams:
- vision: image analysis via Claude Vision API \(analyze, compare, suggest\)
- planner: goal decomposition with 6 pattern templates
- memory: JSONL outcome tracking with aggregation-based recommendations
- orchestrator: parallel sub-tasks with tool access profiles
- optimizer: TensorRT/CUTLASS-aware GPU profiling and auto-optimization
- demo: guided walkthrough scenarios for streams/podcasts

Context engineering features \(9 total\):
- Session-aware system prompts with dynamic knowledge loading
- Structured compaction and observation masking
- Semantic composition tools \(add_node, connect_nodes, set_input\)
- Pre-execution validation, workflow templates, tool result formats

Also fixes all 22 ruff lint warnings \(unused imports and variables\).
236 tests passing, 52 tools total.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add 9 features: CivitAI, MCP server, model compat, implicit feedback, and more

Features added \(61 tools total, 320 tests passing\):
- CivitAI API integration \(search, detail, trending — 3 tools\)
- Contextual recommendations engine \(workflow-aware suggestions\)
- Perceptual hash comparison via Pillow \(aHash + pixel diff\)
- WebSocket execution monitoring \(node-by-node timing\)
- Model compatibility matrix \(SD1.5/SDXL/Flux/SD3 — 2 tools\)
- Integration tests \(7 multi-tool workflow scenarios\)
- MCP transport adapter \(stdio server, `agent mcp` command\)
- Registry freshness tracking \(staleness detection + cache refresh\)
- Implicit feedback detection \(reuse, abandonment, refinement, regression\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(sudo powershell -Command "Add-MpPreference -ExclusionPath ''C:\\Users\\User\\AppData\\Roaming\\Claude''; Add-MpPreference -ExclusionPath ''C:\\Users\\User\\AppData\\Local\\claude-cli-nodejs''; Write-Host ''Exclusions added successfully''; Get-MpPreference | Select-Object -ExpandProperty ExclusionPath")

Bash(powershell.exe -Command "Get-ChildItem ''G:\\COMFYUI_Database\\output'' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | Select-Object -First 3 Name; \(Get-Item ''G:\\COMFYUI_Database\\output'' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue\).Target; \(Get-Item ''G:\\COMFYUI_Database\\Output'' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue\).Target")
Bash(# Look for the actual ComfyUI web/scripts directory find /g -maxdepth 4 -type d -name ""scripts"")
Bash(# Find the main ComfyUI installation \(not the database\) find /c /d /e /f /g /h -maxdepth 5 -type d -name ""ComfyUI"")
Bash(# Modern ComfyUI uses a compiled frontend. Check app/assets or similar find /c/ComfyUI/app/assets -name ""*.js"")
Bash(# Check frontend_management.py to understand where the frontend is served from cat /c/ComfyUI/app/frontend_management.py)
Bash(# Find the installed comfyui-frontend-package find /c -path ""*/comfyui_frontend*"" -name ""*.js"")
Bash(# Also search all the readable custom node JS files that reference graphToPrompt grep -rn ""graphToPrompt"" /g/COMFYUI_Database/Custom_Nodes/)

Bash(# The bat says C:\\Users\\User\\Documents\\comfy\\ComfyUI but it doesn''t exist # Maybe it was mapped or the actual path is different # Let''s check where ComfyUI stores its extra_model_paths ls ""G:/COMFYUI_Database/extra_model_paths.yaml"" && cat ""G:/COMFYUI_Database/extra_model_paths.yaml"" # Or check the output folder which should be alongside main.py find /g -maxdepth 3 -name ""server.py"" -path ""*comfy*"")
